alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Glasscock, Mitchell, Scurry, eastern Borden and eastern Howard Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Fluvanna to 9 miles east of Forsan. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Colorado City, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Fluvanna, Sand Springs, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Vincent, Hermleigh, Randalls Corner, Winston Field, Cuthbert and Knapp. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 184 and 228. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
